sentences: Vegard Sverre Tveitan (born 10 October 1975), better known as Ihsahn (), is a Norwegian multi-instrumentalist, vocalist and composer, best known for his work with black metal band Emperor.
Since 2006, Tveitan has primarily devoted himself to solo albums and occasional guest appearances.
Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer =
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: In 1990 Tveitan joined Haugen's band Xerasia, a death metal band in which he played guitar and keyboards.
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: They eventually changed their name to Embryonic sometime that year.
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: In November, the band released a self-financed four-track demo titled The Land of the Lost Souls.
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: In 1991 they changed their name again to Thou Shalt Suffer.
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: The project was partially funded by a government grant and the group made several releases in 1990 and 1991.
section: == Biography == | === Early years: Xerasia, Embryonic, and Thou Shalt Suffer ===

sentences: Later in 1991 Haugen and Tveitan formed Emperor.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: The band at this time received a lot of support and encouragement from black metal pioneer Euronymous, and after several demos, the Emperor EP was released in 1993 to much acclaim.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: Tveitan retreated to a property owned by his family to compose much of what would later become Anthems to the Welkin at Dusk, which was recorded after Haugen's parole.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: In 1995 the cult album Blood Must be Shed, by Zyklon-B was released featuring members of Emperor and Satyricon.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: In 1998 Tveitan and his wife Heidi Solberg Tveitan—who at the time used the stage name Ihriel—formed the experimental band Peccatum.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: Peccatum would eventually becoming his main project until its termination on 4 March 2006.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: In 1999 Emperor released IX Equilibrium, Tveitan's third studio album with the group.
section: == Biography == | === Formation of Emperor and Peccatum ===

sentences: Two years later, in 2001, Peccatum released their second studio album, Amor Fati.

== Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: In April 2006, Tveitan released his first solo album, The Adversary.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: The Adversary was recorded at Symphonique Studios in Norway and was released on his label Mnemosyne Productions, which he founded in 2003 with Starofash.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: He released his second studio album, titled angL, the following year, featuring Lars K. Norberg on bass, Asgeir Mickelson on drums, and guest vocals from Mikael Åkerfeldt (of Opeth) on the track "Unhealer".
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: In March 2009, Tveitan performed some of his solo material live for the first time, in a one-off performance opening for Opeth in Norway.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: Grimen, the only album by side project 'Hardingrock' was released the same year.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

sentences: Tveitan released his third solo album, After, in January 2010.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2006–2010: The Adversary, angL, and After ====

== Biography == | ==== 2016–2018: Arktis and Àmr ====

sentences: In April 2016, Tveitan released his sixth studio album, Arktis, on Candlelight Records.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2016–2018: Arktis and Àmr ====

sentences: The album cover features a photograph of Fridtjof Nansen, whose 1896 mission to the North Pole fits with the lyrical atmosphere of the album.
section: == Biography == | ==== 2016–2018: Arktis and Àmr ====

sentences: They also share their birthday of 10 October.

sentences: In 2002, Tveitan was awarded the Notodden kommunes kulturpris (Notodden Municipality's Culture prize).
section: == Biography == | === Awards and publications ===

sentences: Tveitan lent his voice in 2007 to an animated character from the Adult Swim cartoon Metalocalypse, Eric von Wiechlinghammer, in the episode "Dethfashion".
section: == Biography == | === Awards and publications ===

sentences: In an interview in 2012, Tveitan cited Iron Maiden, King Diamond, Judas Priest, and Pink Floyd as influential artists when he was young.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: Ihsahn described himself a Satanist in the 1990s.
section: == Personal life == | === Beliefs ===

sentences: As he explained in 1994, he considered Satanism to be hard to define, as there are different ways of Satanism, and to be more of a category the individual would have to set for themselves.
section: == Personal life == | === Beliefs ===

sentences: In a 1994 interview, Ihsahn described a social Darwinist influence on his Satanism, calling himself anti-Christian and saying it is "not for a weak person", while also expressing respect towards European paganism, meditation and stewardship of the environment.
section: == Personal life == | === Beliefs ===
